required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Time Restricted Feeding, Muscle, and Metabolism
clinical_study.official_title: Time Restricted Feeding Intervention for Muscle and Metabolic Health (TRIMM)

brief_summary.textblock: Effective nutrition strategies for combatting and/or preventing obesity still need to be identified. This has been the case despite the numerous and different approaches that have been taken. Potential targets for combatting/preventing obesity have been identified, but long-term solutions have not emerged. This study uses time restricted feeding to study the role of dietary protein in obesity prevention and/or treatment. The objectives are to determine the role of skeletal muscle mass as a driver of energy-sensing mechanisms and peripheral signals that regulate appetite and energy intake in overweight and obese adults and to determine the effects of protein timing on muscle mass to regulate appetite and energy intake in overweight and obese adults.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline and final day (day 120) of the intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Body composition measured using dual x-ray absorptiometry to determine the ration of lean/fat-free mass to fat mass.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline and final day (day 120) of the intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: Whole body protein turnover will be measured using 15N-alanine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline and final day (day 120) of the intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: Muscle mass will be measured using D3-creatine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline, 4, 8, and 12 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight will be measured in kilograms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep will be assessed using wrist Actigraphy for sleep duration and total time in bed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline, 4, 8, and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep quality will be measured using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index survey

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline, 4, 8, and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Mood will be assessed using the Profile of Mood States Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline, 4, 8, and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Grit will be assessed using the grit questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline, 4, 8, and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Physical activity will be measured using the iPAQ survey

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline, 4, 8, and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Dietary intake will be measured using weighed, 3-day food records

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline, 4, 8, and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose will be measured as mg/dl

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline, 4, 8, and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Hand grip will be measured using a dynamometer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change is being assessed at baseline, 4, 8, and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected and plasma amino acids and metabolites will be assessed using commercially available kit for amino acid analysis for all circulating amino acids.

arm_group.description: Follows time restricted feeding protocol, consumes protein supplement
Follows time restricted feeding protocol, consumes ketogenic supplement

intervention.description: Participants consume whey protein at the beginning of the eating period.
Participants consume ketogenic aid upon waking.

intervention.intervention_name: Control group - time restricted feeding only

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Resides in Northwest Arkansas
- Age 25-50 years
- BMI > 25
- All ethnicities
- Female and male
Exclusion Criteria:
- Food allergies
- Pregnant or breastfeeding
- Dietary restrictions (e.g. vegetarian, vegan, etc.)
- Trying to lose weight in last 3 months
- Pre-existing health conditions related to obesity (e.g. cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension)
- Prescription medications related to heart disease or type 2 diabetes
- Fear of needles
- Smoker or vaping
- Currently taking protein supplements or other nutritional supplements which may interfere with study outcomes
- Consumes >4 alcoholic beverages per week
